English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>!

English (United States)(en-US): How have you been?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잘 지냈어? 오늘도 들려줄 이야기가 있어!

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, would you\nlike to know a secret?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 비밀을 하나 알려 줄까?

English (United States)(en-US): She wasn’t afraid to show what was under\nher hat. She was looking forward to it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그녀는 모자 속을 보여 주기를 두려워하지\n않았어. 오히려 기대하고 있었지.

English (United States)(en-US): To what?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무엇을?

English (United States)(en-US): To someone seeing her\nand all her faces.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 누군가가 자신의 모든 면들을 알아봐 주길.

English (United States)(en-US): And to have each and every\nversion of her understood.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 매번 보여 주는 모습이\n다른 자신이 이해받을 수 있기를.

English (United States)(en-US): She was waiting for a long time.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오랫동안 기다려 왔던 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): I wonder how she felt? I’m not sure yet.|I think I understand how she felt.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건 어떤 마음일까? 아직 잘 모르겠어.|그녀가 어떤 마음이었는지 알 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): Some desires are hard to fathom.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 가늠하기 힘든 갈망이 있지.

English (United States)(en-US): But I think I understand. I know the feeling.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데 난 조금 알 것 같아. 실은 나도 비슷하거든.

English (United States)(en-US): You have steep edges like that too?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너도 그런 가파른 구석을 가지고 있는 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): I do too. I know the feeling.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나도 그래. 실은 나도 비슷하거든.

English (United States)(en-US): I struggle between hoping you won’t discover\nmy vile self and longing for you to draw closer.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 너에게 내 추악한 몰골을 들키지 않기를\n바라면서 한편으로는 한없이 가까워지길 원하고 있으니.

English (United States)(en-US): What do I look like to you?\nWhat face do you know me by?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네가 보는 지금의 나는 어때?\n어떤 모습에 가장 가까워?

English (United States)(en-US): A chatterbox of an alien being|A black bookworm from the moon|A slightly difficult but special friend|I’m not sure just yet.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 수다 떨기를 좋아하는 외계 생명체|달에서 떨어진 검은 책벌레|조금 까다롭지만 특별한 친구|아직은 잘 모르겠어

English (United States)(en-US): ... Really?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 정말이야?

English (United States)(en-US): You’re right. A chattering blobby creature,\ndistinctly not human. One of my faces.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 맞아. 조잘거리는, 인간이 아닌\n 괴물. 내 모습 중 하나지.

English (United States)(en-US): It truly is exquisite to breathe in\nbooks and their many scents.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다채로운 향을 가진 책을 음미하는\n시간은 정말이지 완벽해!

English (United States)(en-US): And so is talking to a human such as you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 물론 너라는 인간과 대화하는 시간도 마찬가지야.

English (United States)(en-US): ... I won’t deny that I’m difficult.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 내가 까다롭다는 걸 부정하지는 않을게.

English (United States)(en-US): But <nickname>, I’ll always be here\nwaiting whenever you want.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 <nickname>, 네가 원한다면 언제든\n이 자리에서 너를 기다리고 있을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Mm... I see. Just know that there is so\nmuch more to me you don’t know yet.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 으음... 그렇구나. 네게 아직 보여 주지\n못한 모습들이 많다는 것만 알아줘.

English (United States)(en-US): I have so many stories to tell you!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 앞으로 너에게 들려줄 이야기가 무궁무진해!

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, what about you? Do you have\na thousand faces like the White Hat?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 너는 어때? 너도 하얀 모자처럼\n수많은 얼굴을 가지고 있어?

English (United States)(en-US): Do they change freely through space and time,\nshaped by who you meet and what you feel?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 공간, 태양의 고도, 함께하는 이에 따라\n보여 주는 모습이 달라지기도 해?

English (United States)(en-US): Now I want to hear about you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이제 네 이야기를 듣고 싶어.

English (United States)(en-US): I want to be intimately\naware of your deepest shades.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네가 가진 내밀한 빛깔을 속속들이 알고 싶어.

English (United States)(en-US): From the ordinary ones everyone else has
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 누구나 가진 것 같이 평범해 보이는 모습도 좋아.

English (United States)(en-US): to the sticky and prickly parts you keep hidden.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 또는 남몰래 숨겨 왔던, 들춰 보면\n끈적거리거나 따가운 부분까지도.

English (United States)(en-US): Well, sometimes I...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음, 나는 말이지...

English (United States)(en-US): giggle like a child when eating good food.|weep while watching sad movies.|ponder silently when I’m alone.|act silly with the ones I love.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 맛있는 음식을 먹으면 아이같이 기뻐해.|슬픈 영화에 몰입하며 눈물 흘리기도 해.|혼자일 때면 조용히 사색해.|사랑하는 사람들과 실없는 대화를 해.

English (United States)(en-US): look at one’s pain and feel relieved it’s not mine.|strive to act my best in front of others.|constantly compare myself to my close ones.|judge the status of those I meet.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 타인에게 닥친 불행을 건너보며 안도해.|남에게 잘 보이기 위해서 갖은 애를 써.|가까운 사람과 나를 끊임없이 비교해.|마주치는 사람의 위치를 계산해.

English (United States)(en-US): am addicted to the heady thrill others give me.|hide my emptiness and fake perfection.|act irrationally out of thundering emotions.|want to linger in the shimmering past.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 타인이 주는 위험한 쾌감에서 헤어 나오지 못해.|텅 빈 나를 숨기고 완벽한 나로 인정받으려 해.|몰아치는 감정에 휩쓸려 평소와 다른 일을 해.|빛나던 과거에 영원히 머물러 있고 싶어해.

English (United States)(en-US): I see. <nickname>, you are beautiful\nfor each and every one of your faces.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇구나. <nickname>, 여러 개의\n얼굴을 품고 있는 네가 아름다워.

English (United States)(en-US): Perhaps those countless faces within\nare what makes humans so colorful.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어쩌면 인간 내면에 엉켜 있는 수많은 얼굴들이\n인간을 더욱 다채롭게 만드는 것일지도 몰라.

English (United States)(en-US): But what I see, feel, and infer from your\nwords... is only a very, very small part of you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 내가 보고 느끼고 너의 말로 유추할 수\n있는 부분은 너의 아주, 아주 일부분에 불과해.

English (United States)(en-US): You change depending on who you’re with.\nLike how you treat the mold and me differently.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 누구와 함께하는지에 따라 너는 달라지겠지. 곰팡이를\n대할 때와 나를 대할 때의 네가 다른 것처럼.

English (United States)(en-US): The you of yesterday, of a few hours later,\nand of tomorrow will surely be different.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어제의 너와 몇 시간 후의 너, 내일의\n너도 분명히 조금씩 다를 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Time collects, layer by layer—like dust\non the shelf, always out of sight.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 시간이 책장 위 먼지처럼 눈치 채지 못한\n사이 켜켜이 쌓이고 있으니 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, what does the\ninside of your hat look like?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 네 모자 속은 어떤 모양이야?

English (United States)(en-US): Will grasping all that’s inside\nlead me to the ‘real’ you?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 안에 있는 것들을 양껏 모아 쥐면\n‘진짜’ 너에게 발돋움할 수 있을까?

English (United States)(en-US): The real me...?
Oh, Dot. You think there’s one\nreal face out of all of them?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 뭉치 너는 내 여러 모습들 중에\n‘진짜’가 있다고 생각하는 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes. The one face from which all others come\nfrom. Isn’t that what people mean by real?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응. 모든 모습들의 근원이 되는 ‘단 하나’ 말이야.\n그걸 ‘진짜’라고 말하는 거 아니야?

English (United States)(en-US): Wait, wait. What does it mean to be ‘real’?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잠깐, 잠깐... ‘진짜’가 뭐지?

English (United States)(en-US): Are you born with it? Does it never,\nunder any circumstances, change?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 가지고 태어나는 것? 절대로, 무슨 일이\n있어도 변하지 않는 것인가?

English (United States)(en-US): Like planted seeds wriggling within myself--\nirrevocable, terrible, yet untraceable?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나에겐 돌이킬 수 없는, 처절한, 더는 찾을 수\n없는, 심어진 씨앗 같은 것들이 우글거리는데?

English (United States)(en-US): Say I was born from a crimson kind of evil\nthat urges humans. Like a sharp push.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이를 테면 내가 인간을 칼날 같은 충동으로\n들이미는 새빨간 악에서 조야하게 태어났다는 것,

English (United States)(en-US): Or that I wake up every morning and\nstretch out my vast void of a body.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 매일 아침 거대한 심연을 닮은\n몸뚱이로 기지개를 켜야 하는 것.

English (United States)(en-US): These things, squished and\nspat out, are the real me?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이들을 마구 쥐었다 뱉은\n덩어리 따위가 ‘진짜’ 나라고?

English (United States)(en-US): (But who knows if a ‘real’ self even exists?)|(But I don’t think Dot is fake at all.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (하지만 '진짜' 본모습의 존재 자체가 불확실한걸...)|(내가 보는 뭉치의 모습이 가짜라고 생각하지 않아.)

English (United States)(en-US): No, Dot. The very concept of something\nbeing real might be made up.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아냐, 뭉치. 모든 모습들의 근원이 되는\n‘진짜’라는 것조차 만들어진 허상일 수 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): So please don’t jump to any\nconclusions about yourself.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니 너 자신을 섣불리 단정 짓지 말아 줘.

English (United States)(en-US): No, Dot. You’re thoughtful, soft, and warm.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아냐, 뭉치. 넌 생각이 깊고,\n부드럽고, 따스한 심성을 가졌잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): To me, those parts of you are what’s real.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너의 검정은, 이러한 다정한 구석들까지\n집어삼킬 정도로 강하지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): I think I need to be alone.\nWould you stop by later?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나 혼자 있을 시간이 필요한 것 같아.\n이따 다시 찾아와 줄래?

English (United States)(en-US): Hello Dot.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 안녕 뭉치.

English (United States)(en-US): ... Do you still want to be alone?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 혹시 아직 혼자 있고 싶어?

English (United States)(en-US): It seems like you had\na pleasant time,<nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 편안한 시간을 보내고\n온 것 같아, <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): Your smile is firmer.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 미소가 조금 더 짙어졌어.

English (United States)(en-US): This is who you really are, right?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 역시 지금의 네가 너의 본모습인 거지?

English (United States)(en-US): Hmm? What makes you think so?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응? 왜 그렇게 생각해?

English (United States)(en-US): Because you’ve always looked\nat me warmly, <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname> 너는 늘 나를\n따뜻하게 바라봐 주었으니까.

English (United States)(en-US): And I can’t stand to think otherwise.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇게 생각하지 않으면 견딜 수가 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): If it wasn’t real... if it was\nall just pretend, I...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 모습이 진짜가 아니면... 거짓이라면 난...

English (United States)(en-US): I think I know how you feel.|You don’t have to worry, Dot.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 어떤 불안함인지 알 것 같아.|그런 거라면 걱정하지 않아도 돼.

English (United States)(en-US): So I promise I’ll always be true\nto you when we’re together.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니 너와 함께할 때엔 늘 진심이겠다고 약속할게.

English (United States)(en-US): I’ve always been myself with you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너와 함께할 때의 나는 늘 변함없이 나였으니까.

English (United States)(en-US): ...Really? I don’t need to use\nwhat humans call a ‘polygraph’?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 정말이야? 인간들의 ‘거짓말 탐지기’를\n사용하지 않아도 되겠지?

English (United States)(en-US): (Where did Dot learn that from?)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (그런 건 어디서 봤을까?)

English (United States)(en-US): Of course. I was the real me before\nI went out, as I still am right now.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼. 외출 전의 나도,\n지금의 나도 진짜 나야.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s just that people can’t be consistent\nevery single minute, hour, and day.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 단지 매일, 매 분, 매 시간이\n같은 모습일 수 없는 것뿐이야.

English (United States)(en-US): ...They’re human.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 인간이니까.

English (United States)(en-US): So, so, the thorny part of you that\nyou told me earlier is also the real you?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼, 그럼, 전에 내게 말해 준 따가운\n모습의 너도 ‘진짜’ 너라는 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): The vile desires shifting deep within you,\nthose painful impulses and blues are truly you?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너의 깊은 곳에서 몸을 뒤척이는 추한 욕망도,\n고통스러운 충동과 우울도 너의 본모습이야?

English (United States)(en-US): It’s not a disguise? Were you\nborn with it? Are you hiding it?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뒤집어 쓴 게 아니야? 가지고\n태어난 거야? 감추고 있는 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): I think so, not that I’m proud of it.|I’m not sure about that. What do you think?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인정하기 싫지만 그런 것 같기도 해.|그것까지는 잘 모르겠어. 뭉치 생각은 어때?

English (United States)(en-US): ... You’re always <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... <nickname>, 너는 언제나 너였던 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): The way the Earth is always the Earth, in its\nvarying shades of light and sunsets and dark.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아침 햇살이 비칠 때와 노을이 질 때, 어둠이 \n짙을 때 다른 색을 품지만 지구가 늘 지구인 것처럼.

English (United States)(en-US): They just appear to be different, but\neverything belongs solely to them.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다른 모습으로 ‘나타날’ 뿐, 모든\n모습들이 전부 그 사람의 것인 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): There’s no use in telling\napart what’s real and fake.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 진짜와 가짜를 구분하는\n것은 의미가 없어지지.

English (United States)(en-US): No need to worry over what’s real, weep over\nwhat’s not, or blame either one of them.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 진짜일까 불안해하지도, 가짜라고 슬퍼하지도, 어느\n한 쪽을 탓하며 손가락질하지 않아도 되는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): If all my faces are really just who I am,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네 말대로 내가 가진 모든 모습들이 그저 나라면,

English (United States)(en-US): (That’s soothing.)|(I’m still lost. Who am I?)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (어쩐지 안심이 돼.)|(... 여전히 혼란스러워. 나도 날 모르겠는 기분.)

English (United States)(en-US): then having a number of them\ndoesn’t mean I’m a paradox, or a fraud.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 여러 개의 모습을 가졌다고 해서 특별히\n모순적이거나 가식적인 사람이 아니라는 거구나.

English (United States)(en-US): ... That’s good to know.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 다행이야.

English (United States)(en-US): But then why do my inner selves\nconflict with each other at times?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 종종 내 안에서 여러 개의\n내가 충돌하는 건 왜일까?

English (United States)(en-US): ... I’m still lost.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 여전히 혼란스러워.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s up to you to decide what face\nyou want to show, <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떤 모습을 보여 줄지\n선택하는 건 <nickname>의 몫이야.

English (United States)(en-US): That you have a large selection might\nmean you’re just that multi-dimensional.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 보여 주고 싶은 모습이 다양하다는 건,\n그만큼 다채로운 사람이라는 뜻일지도 몰라.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, I want to ask you something.\nDoes this mean I’m like humans?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 물어보고 싶은 게 있어.\n그렇다면 나도 인간과 같을까?

English (United States)(en-US): What do you mean?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그게 무슨 말이야?

English (United States)(en-US): I mean that I want\ndimensions, just like you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아주 입체적인 덩어리 괴물이\n되고 싶다는 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): I want to be me. Be it a depressed\nnobody with a black wobbly body,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 검고 흐물거리는 몸을 가지고\n좌절하는 하찮은 나도,

English (United States)(en-US): or a thinker pondering with\nyou over beloved humans. Just me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너라는 친구와 사랑하는 인간에 대해 사유하는\n나도 전부 나로서 존재할 수 있으면 해.

English (United States)(en-US): Even with these arms full of despair, I still long to make room for hope.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우글거리는 모든 절망을 끌어안은\n동시에 희망을 품을 수 있으면 해...

English (United States)(en-US): so that, surrounded by possibilities of the days\nahead, I’ll be less lonely than the one before.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러면 다양한 내일의 가능성 속에서\n어제보다 덜 외로운 내가 될 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Do you think I can? Could I really?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 부디 그럴 수 있을까? 응?
